title: 104_hr2834
content: The Act titled "Federal Accountability and Institutional Reform in Education Act of 1995" aims to address reductions in postsecondary education spending and improve accountability in educational institutions, lenders, and guarantee agencies. It emphasizes the need for reforms to enhance compliance with Department of Education policies. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require proof of contact with institutions and diligent attempts for reimbursement. A limitation is added to prevent eligible entities from retaining proceeds from previous claims. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require proof of contact with institutions and diligent attempts for reimbursement. A limitation is added to prevent eligible entities from retaining proceeds from previous claims. Additionally, the Secretary is required to report annually to Congress on compliance with servicing and due diligence requirements by lenders, servicers, and guaranty agencies. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require proof of contact with institutions and diligent attempts for reimbursement. A limitation is added to prevent eligible entities from retaining proceeds from previous claims. The Secretary shall provide information on successful practices to encourage duplication of servicing and collection programs. Section 435(a)(2) is amended to uniformly apply circumstances to all eligible institutions. The Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require a student completion rate and job placement rate of 60 percent or greater. Section 435(m)(1)(B) is amended to specify the requirements for properly paid claims. SEC. 4. ELIGIBLE INSTITUTION REFORM. Section 481 (b) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 is amended to require institutions to have their financial reviews conducted by independent auditors using accepted accounting principles. It also clarifies that revenues from non-eligible programs must be considered separately for compliance purposes. The Secretary shall not consider the financial information of any institution for a fiscal year that began on or before April 30, 1994. SEC. 5 amends Section 498(c) of the Higher Education Act of 1965 to require institutions to provide accounting procedures based on audited financial statements using generally accepted accounting principles.
